alert.note: Alert for Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Petroleum County through 445 PM MDT... At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles east of Roy to 15 miles northeast of Grass Range. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tiegen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
